The Chandler Warehouse Emergency Action Program consists of a Business Continuity Plan and facility-specific Emergency Action Plan. The Emergency Action Program outlines the instructions and required information in order to respond to fire, chemical spills, natural disasters and other emergencies that may arise. The Emergency action plan and documents are reviewed at least annually and revised as necessary to reflect changes that may occur to content and structure of the plan.
Notification Exercises:
In response to the requirements set forth in 40 CFR 68.96(a), Rinchem has developed procedures to conduct an exercise of the stationary source's emergency response notification mechanisms. As all Rinchem Company, LLC facilities are non-responding stationary sources, Rinchem management and EHS recognize the importance of communication to emergency
response organizations that hazards that are present at Rinchem facilities. Rinchem has, and will continue to send community outreach letters to emergency response organizations (LEPC, Fire and Police) and invite these organizations to tour our stationary sources and participate in accidental release drills.
1.6 Planned changes to improve safety:
The facility evaluates, resolves, and implements employee suggestions and recommendations resulting from routine hazard reviews, audits, process hazard analyses, and incident
investigations. Changes may be made to improve safety based on comments and information developed within our organization and the industry. Rinchem is always looking at ways to minimize risk through process improvement, upgrades to equipment used in the process, and review of operating procedures.

The storage location of each material is tracked in an electronic inventory management system. After an order is received, Rinchem ships the above listed chemicals as ordered by the end user. The material is picked and staged for quality and safety inspection. After the material passes inspection, it is loaded on to a truck for shipment using a forklift.
1.3. The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps Rinchem management realizes that implementation of appropriate administrative and technological safeguards ensure the safety of the workers and the continued safety of public receptors. Those recommendations that are planned for implementation will be discussed in Planned Changes to Improve Safety. The safeguards include both administrative and technological safeguards that prevent, detect, or mitigate releases of arsine, chlorine, ammonia 20%, hydrochloric acid 37%, dichlorosilane, and tetramethylsilane.
1.4. The Five Year Accident History
There has never been a reportable accident involvingarsine, chlorine, ammonia 20%, hydrochloric acid 37%, dichlorosilane, and tetramethylsilane or any other chemical at the Rinchem Company LLC, Chandler AZ Warehouse.
1.5. The Emergency Action Program
Overall safety at the Rinchem Company, LLC, Chandler, AZ Warehouse is governed not only by our ability to prevent accidental releases of arsine, chlorine, ammonia 20%, hydrochloric acid 37%, dichlorosilane, and tetramethylsilane from occurring, but also by the ability to mitigate any accidental releases of the above mentioned materials. Rinchem has developed an emergency action program to minimize the effects of accidental releases of arsine, chlorine, ammonia 20%, hydrochloric acid 37%, dichlorosilane, and tetramethylsilane to employees. Rinchem management has opted to respond to releases of these chemicals by mitiga

, being the most familiar with actual operations, are responsible to document suggestions for continual improvements. Each employee is granted the authority to stop work if it is deemed unsafe. The job will not be continued until the work methods are evaluated and changed, if necessary, to make the work area safe. Management continues to do all it can to protect the Health and Safety of all staff and to provide a safe working environment. However, safety requires the participation of everyone...only you can
make safety a reality. Be alert for conditions which appear unsafe. Report unsafe conditions immediately, Report any accident, near miss, exposure, incident, spill or release.
1.2. A Description of the Chandler, AZ. Facility and Regulated Substances Handled
1.2.1. Description of the Chandler, AZ. Facility
The Chandler, AZ. facility is located at 6805 W. Morelos Pl. Chandler, AZ. The facility provides transportation and public warehousing services for manufacturers, distributors and end
users of pre-packaged specialty chemicals. Warehousing activities include shipping, receiving and storage of chemicals as specified by customer requirements. Due to the growth of the computer chip manufacturing in the area, the chemicals stored at the Chandler AZ warehouse to support this growth is anticipated to increase.  Chemicals containing toxic hazards such as arsine, chlorine, ammonia 20%, and hydrochloric acid 37% are the RMP regulated substances handled at the site. In addition, RMP regulated flammable substances dichlorsilane and tetramethylsilane will also be stored at the Chandler AZ warehouse and may exceed RMP threshold quantities.
1.2.2. Description of the Warehousing and Storage Processes
Rinchem receives arsine, chlorine, ammonia 20%, hydrochloric acid 37%, dichlorosilane, and tetramethylsilane by truck as shipped from the manufacturer or distributor. It is unloaded from the truck using a forklift or cylinder dolly and staged for inspection. After the material pa

1.0 Executive Summary
1.1. The Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Action Policies at the Rinchem Company Inc. Chandler, AZ Facility
Rinchem Company, LLC. (Rinchem) is committed to being a responsible member of the community in which it operates by giving top priority to operating in a safe and environmentally sound manner. Policy dictates that Rinchem personnel continuously identify methods to reduce the risk of handling hazardous materials and to reduce the risk to the community and environment through implementation of new technology and procedures. This commitment to safe and environmentally sound operations is documented in the Team Member Handbook, and the mission statement, which are available to all employees. The Safety and Health policy states: SAFETY FIRST is more than a slogan at Rinchem...it is a way of life. Rinchem Company, Inc., is
committed to providing a safe working environment for its staff members, its customers and the public, and maintains that NO JOB IS MORE IMPORTANT THAN THE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF OUR STAFF MEMBERS,OUR COMMUNITIES, AND THE ENVIRONMENT.
We recognize that the responsibilities for safety and health are shared: Management, in particular the VP of Operations and EHS, accepts the responsibility for leadership of the safety and health program, for its effectiveness and improvement, and for providing the safeguards required to ensure safe conditions. Managers and supervisors are responsible for ensuring processes are documented which reinforce safety as well as the use of engineering controls as the preferred method of promoting safety and eliminating unsafe conditions. Staff members are responsible for cooperation with all aspects of the safety and health program including compliance with all rules, documented procedures, and regulations and for continuously
practicing safety while performing their duties. Staff members are responsible for stopping activities that may lead to injuries to themselves or
others. Staff members
